intro: Stenanthemum leucophractum, commonly known as the white-fringed stenanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal and inland areas. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with prominent fringed petals that give it its common name. It is often found in open habitats such as woodlands and shrublands.
